top_categories.workout_context: Lake Country Gravel’s wisconsin rolling, local event demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Lake Country Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Lake Country Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Lake Country Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Lake Country Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Lake Country Gravel’s wisconsin rolling gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The varied gradients at Lake Country Gravel reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Lake Country Gravel’s wisconsin rolling gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Lake Country Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Lake Country Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Lake Country Gravel’s wisconsin rolling gravel delivers on race day.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Lake Country Gravel’s 3,200ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Lake Country Gravel’s 70 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Lake Country Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on wisconsin rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: wisconsin rolling, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 70 miles of wisconsin rolling gravel in Oconomowoc, Wisconsin.
